alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Franklin (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 01 at 8:17PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New York, including the following counties, Clinton and Franklin. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 815 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Rainfall rates in excess of 1 inch per hour are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Saranac, Altona, Dannemora, Jericho, Lyon Mountain, Clayburg, Chazy Lake, Ellenburg Mountain, Moffittsville, Moffitsville, Alder Bend, Redford, Miner Lake State Park and Irona. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
